title: [Bug]: Can't join meetings in the lobby
body: ### Can you reproduce this bug in the website/PWA? No ### Describe the bug When calls are configured in such a way that I have to wait in the lobby until approved by a participant, Teams For Linux just shows an error where the Web App (tried in Chrome) shows the "Guest user" UX. ### What package are you using? rpm ### Version 2.0.17 ### Reproduction steps ```markdown 1. Open an invitation that requires me to wait in the lobby for approval (I can provide privately a link to test). 2. Teams-for-linux tries to open the link but then shows an error message: We've run into an issue. 3. The restart button reloads the UI but results in the same message. 4. The only way out without signing out is to close the application and reopening. ``` ### Expected Behavior ```markdown 1. Open a link which requires waiting in the lobby. 2. See the "guest interface" while waiting to join. 3. Join the call normally. ``` ### Debug ```markdown teams-for-linux --webDebug --logConfig='{}' 17:39:09.167 › second-instance started 17:39:09.168 › processArgs: [ '/opt/teams-for-linux/teams-for-linux', '--allow-file-access-from-files', '--try-supported-channel-layouts', '--disable-features=HardwareMediaKeyHandling', '--enable-features=WebRTCPipeWireCapturer', '--use-fake-ui-for-media-stream', '--auth-server-whitelist=*', '--gtk-version=3', 'msteams://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/[REDACTED]' ] 17:39:09.168 › testing RegExp processArgs false 17:39:09.168 › testing RegExp processArgs false 17:39:09.168 › testing RegExp processArgs false 17:39:09.169 › testing RegExp processArgs false 17:39:09.169 › testing RegExp processArgs false 17:39:09.169 › testing RegExp processArgs false 17:39:09.169 › testing RegExp processArgs false 17:39:09.169 › testing RegExp processArgs false 17:39:09.169 › testing RegExp processArgs false 17:39:09.169 › A url argument received with msteams v2 protocol [345706:0709/173909.257841:ERROR:ui/gl/gl_surface_presentation_helper.cc:260] GetVSyncParametersIfAvailable() failed for 1 times!
